channel.title: We are having a baby girl!
channel.description: So somewhere around February 22nd, 2012 (I'm rooting for the leap year!) there will be either a tiny moparisthebest or a tiny srt8 brought into the world. We are really excited about it and I wanted to share it with you guys, for anyone interested. I don't expect anything to change website-wise, so you don't have to worry about that. :D

item.title: We are having a baby girl!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:142, topic:409988”]On a more serious note…
Are you not worried about overpopulation, climate change and depletion of natural resources?
Like, its most probable the world population will reach 9 billion people by 2040. We’re nearly at 7 billion now.
It was only about 4 billion in the 1960s.

All those new people, who all require food, water, space, education, clothing, jobs.[/quote]
Am I worried? No. We are always depleting resources, but we are also finding new ones and new ways to use the ones we have had for years, I’m confident technology will keep up. I also live in a location with plenty of fresh air and water and land to raise children in, and if it came down to it, I could probably support my family with farming and hunting, so no, I’m not worried personally.

Read full topic
item.source: We are having a baby girl!

We are really excited about it and I wanted to share it with you guys, for anyone interested. I don’t expect anything to change website-wise, so you don’t have to worry about that.

Congratulations!

item.title: We are having a baby girl!
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Obligatory
this was made way back in the 1980s when films were more all-singing all-dancing and comedy didn’t have canned laughter.

On a more serious note…
Are you not worried about overpopulation, climate change and depletion of natural resources?
Like, its most probable the world population will reach 9 billion people by 2040. We’re nearly at 7 billion now.
It was only about 4 billion in the 1960s.

All those new people, who all require food, water, space, education, clothing, jobs.

@super_ yeah like the Koch Brothers (billionaires who fund far-right think tanks and astroturf protests like the Tea party) are Catholics.

Read full topic

item.title: We are having a baby girl!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

runescape3dude:

SRT8 better start teaching this girl kitchen skills from a young age, even reading cook books out loud while she is pregnant will help in the successful development of a female.

Also, having a chain and shackles of the right size with you at all times is very important. Who knows when that kitchen princess decides to leave it’s nest of laziness?

item.title: We are having a baby girl!
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:120, topic:409988”][quote author=yo123 link=topic=511257.msg3726381#msg3726381 date=1314300856]
you’re gonna make MitB one mean dad, but what u say is 100% true … until we move to other planets!!
[/quote]
Or just continue to work on proper renewable energy. To suggest we’ll be done once we run out of oil is a little naive.[/quote]

Plastics are made from oil.
Sure we might get energy others sources of every but the progress isn’t looking too good.

Basically all scenarios where it turns out okay rely on hither-to unknown inventions and new science.
I see most western nations have cut science funding.
